glsa.title: ADOdb: PostgresSQL command injection
glsa.synopsis: ADOdb is vulnerable to SQL injections if used in conjunction with a PostgreSQL database.

background.p: ADOdb is an abstraction library for PHP creating a common API for a wide range of database backends.

description.p: Andy Staudacher discovered that ADOdb does not properly sanitize all parameters.

impact.p: By sending specifically crafted requests to an application that uses ADOdb and a PostgreSQL backend, an attacker might exploit the flaw to execute arbitrary SQL queries on the host.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All ADOdb users should upgrade to the latest version:
